text: it's a video that has outraged to
community and made international
headlines a police officer assigned to a
South Carolina high school violently
moves an uncooperative student from a
classroom as the video spread across the
internet the policeman Ben fields was
accused on social media of using
excessive force students at the high
school tweeted that this wasn't the
first example of abusive behavior by
fields while others noted that the
officer was previously sued for false
arrest and battery in a case that was
later dropped the incident comes in a
community that has been grappling with
racial tensions ten years ago the area
was largely white and affluent now it is
majority black a contentious school
board election last year featured a
white parents group and a black parents
group each endorsing their own slate of
candidates in advancing their own
priorities for the school board now the
black parents group is pointing towards
the episode as an example of quote
highly discriminatory practices on the
part of the school district officer
field has since been suspended without
pay pending the investigation has also
been banned from all school grounds and
the Sheriff's Department has requested
the FBI to investigate there is
absolutely no place in this district or
any other district for that matter for
what happened here yesterday our
tolerance for it is
black rights activist Shawn King has
also weighed in on this
calling episode an outrage and yet
another example of law enforcement
brutality directed against black
Americans but others have defended the
officer's actions noting that Fields is
a trusted member of the school's
community where he serves as a football
and strict training coach and one a
culture of excellence award last year
they point out that the video doesn't
show the student repeatedly ignored her
teacher and school administrator before
the officer was summoned to help remove
her from the classroom school officials
say they are taking this incident
seriously and that the racial diversity
in the district is what makes it great
the persons that are there are not of
the same race I believe that is what
makes it incident of different races not
that it was a racially motivated
incident
